pageContext.description: Sickle is sharp on both sides. Two holes in socket for a pin. Looks as though it was cleaned up with sandpaper.
pageContext.surface: Deeply corroded in uneven shaped pits. These pits are light green and buff. Light green inside socket. Top surface bright metal colour with the streaked appearance that sandpaper filing gives.
pageContext.associations: Found with rapier and palstaves (like Grunty Fen).
pageContext.publications: Mentioned by Evans, p. 199,Prehistoric Bronzes 14, No catalogue.,Bronzes 27, The numbers are to be found in a catalogue called "Museum of Archaeology",Cambridge Antiquarian Society Catalogue 172, 1884.,Fox Arch. Camb. Region, 8 no. 2,Burgess, Ant. J. XIX (1969) fig. 4.1
